channel.title: The Stanley Parable
channel.description:
[url]https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=OIppRUoe70E&feature=player_embedded[/url]
I could just not believe my eyes when nobody talked about this. This mod might not be about gunplay like HL2, but instead is like a happier version of Dear Esther.
You play as a man named Stanley, who worked for a large company where he was employee 427. Others might have found this job soul crushingly boring, however Stanley loved his job, until one day, when the most peculiar thing happened, he had been at work for nearly an hour, until he had noticed, that nobody else had shown up for work.
The rest you will have to find out in this Epic Saga of Stanley

item.title: The Stanley Parable
item.dc:creator: Chaotic
item.description:
Favorite line in the black:
[COLOR=‘Black’]IM NOT REAL! IM NOT REAL! DON’T BELIEVE ANY OF IT NONE IF IT’S REAL!!!

Read full topic

item.title: The Stanley Parable
item.dc:creator: freundin88
item.description:
I downloaded the Stanley Parable and played it today. It’s quite different, I’d say. And yes, he’s remaking the “game”. Harry-UK, he’s looking for people just like you.

Read full topic

item.description:
shit i forgot the red door

Read full topic

item.title: The Stanley Parable
item.dc:creator: Surplus
item.description:
BahamutBBob:

It was meh IMO. The ending where you go up the elevator had potential, and maybe something special actually happened when you quit, but eh. The rest of it was very meh. Why are they going to remake this? Just because Notch gave it a boost in downloads? Or was there something huge that I missed? (it’s possible that I missed an ending, but I think I got them all)

The dev texture room was slightly amusing though.

Because it was a great commentary on video games. You didn’t miss anything you were just to dumb to put it together.

Read full topic

item.title: The Stanley Parable
item.dc:creator: BahamutBBob
item.description:
Fergus, as far as I can tell, I got all of the endings. Following the narrator completely, going up the elevator, down the elevator, red door, blue door, down the stairs, and hitting the wrong valve.

Read full topic

It was meh IMO. The ending where you go up the elevator had potential, and maybe something special actually happened when you quit, but eh. The rest of it was very meh. Why are they going to remake this? Just because Notch gave it a boost in downloads? Or was there something huge that I missed? (it’s possible that I missed an ending, but I think I got them all)

The dev texture room was slightly amusing though.

Did you go down with the elevator? I missed that ending until I watch a youtube video

King_Kaddo:

the guy who made the mod?

I’m not that stupid, I wonder what they stand for. I haven’t seen a name anywhere(The modb page) that tell me that.

item.title: The Stanley Parable
item.dc:creator: danielsangeo
item.description:
King_Kaddo:

Does anyone know what the buttons on the wall turning on red or white lights in the control room do? Or are they just a scam?

Reading the commentary, it is revealed that (spoilers in the black) [COLOR=‘Black’]the buttons simply light up the lights. They don’t do anything and turning on the generator simply starts a countdown to your death.

Read full topic

the guy who made the mod?

item.title: The Stanley Parable
item.dc:creator: FERGUS
item.description:
So who, or what is JP? Because when you come to the ending where “Press “key” on your keyboard” followed by some phrases and then “please die”, it spell out “by JP”.

Also, typing kill in the console there doesn’t do anything. I thought that because it said “please die” I should do it and it would bring me somewhere else, I’m dissapointed.

Read full topic

item.title: The Stanley Parable

item.description:
Also, Stanley was addicted to drugs and hookers.

Loved it.

item.title: The Stanley Parable
item.dc:creator: xalener
item.description:
They’re a scam.

I fucking love the mod. It’s like Douglas Adams came back to life.

And I thought Portal 2 was Douglas Adams-ish. This nailed it.

Read full topic

item.title: The Stanley Parable
item.dc:creator: danielsangeo
item.description:
My favorite part in the Stanley Parable was (spoilers in the black) [COLOR=‘Black’]when you go to the elevator and the narrator says that you are so bad at following directions that’s why everyone probably disappeared.

Game was rather short, though.

Read full topic

item.title: The Stanley Parable
item.dc:creator: Phobos001
item.description:
This was awesome, and I am overjoyed by there being a thread about it.

[SPOLIERS]

My favorite part was the nuclear detonation sequence when he tells you EXACTLY what you are doing. I loved it because it was true. “YES I AM TRYING TO FIND AN EXIT SO SHUT UP REFSPIRNAHAOTHJATRGH boom”

Read full topic

item.title: The Stanley Parable
item.dc:creator: calhoun_freeman
item.description:
Saw all 6 endings, was FANTASTIC. I LOVED EVERY MINUTE OF IT.

Except few glitches. Like you can trap yourself in several occasions by closing doors that the narrator has opened.

Also, it’s sometimes very vague, but it’s the beauty of it. Nice job devs!

Read full topic
